subject: [Lab 7] Q2: WWPD: Trees
content:
Q2: WWPD: Trees

Please post all questions you have below concerning Q2: WWPD: Trees in the follow-ups.

If you are stuck on this question, feel free to read through the follow-up responses to see if you can draw any ideas from them.

threads.question: can anyone help me with this WWPD? shouldn't it print out the object?  >>> t.label = t.branches[0].label  >>> t  ?

follow-ups.feedback: The interpreter uses the __repr__ method to display objects. Look it up in the class.
Yes, but the new object/Tree instance it prints out should have it's first label as 2, right?
Shouldn't this be Tree(2, Tree(2))? Why isn't it?
check the repr again - how are branches represented.
Any luck with this one? Still trying to figure it out.
